subject: Faulty Rumble Motor (VAM) Purchased via Amazon
description_text:
Dear Simsonn Support Team,

I recently purchased a set of your rumble motors (VAM) through Amazon. One of the motors has unfortunately stopped working after a short period of use.

Both units worked initially, but one is now completely unresponsive, while the other continues to function normally. I have checked all wiring, connections, and settings to rule out installation or configuration issues.

Please advise on the appropriate next steps for warranty support or replacement. I can provide the Amazon order number, photos, or a video demonstrating the issue if needed.

Thank you for your assistance. I look forward to your response.




Regards,
Shannon Dottin

conversations.body_text: Hi Shannon Dottin,  Could you please provide a video? Please send it to me via Google Drive and make sure the access permission is set to view. Additionally, please provide a screenshot of the vibration motor configuration screen.

Good Day, Please see requested information below. Also, I would have tried the various motors in different ports on controller box. Can confirm the various ports and other motors function. Simsonn Haptic Issue – Google Drive drive.google.com Regards, Shannon Dottin

Hi Shannon Dottin,  You purchased the VAM motor, not the VAM Pro. Therefore, you should not use VAM Pro mode. Using an incorrect mode can quickly damage the VAM motor, especially when long-duration telemetry-based vibration effects are enabled, such as RPM or speed-related effects, which may cause overload and motor failure. Please make sure the correct mode is selected. There should be a clear indication on the mode selection button.

Where is this place information clearly stated prior to usage? S the motor covered for replacement?

Shannon Dottin

Hi Shannon Dottin,  OK, we will ship them to you.   The damage to the VAM motors may be caused by excessive travel and continuous rotation under Speed mode. We recommend setting a reasonable speed range and reducing the vibration intensity—ideally around 50%, and no more than 70%. Also, try to avoid prolonged continuous operation to extend the motor’s lifespan.
